Class Pawn

java.lang.Object
pieces.Piece
pieces.Pawn
public class Pawn extends Piece
Represents a Pawn piece in the game. The Pawn moves one square forward, but captures diagonally. It also has special moves like en passant and promotion when reaching the opponent's back rank.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    boolean
    isFirstMove
    Indicates if the pawn has moved for the first time, relevant for 2-squares moves.
    final int
    value
    The value of a pawn piece, typically used for material evaluation in chess.

  • Method Details

    • enPassant

      public boolean enPassant(Square startSquare, Game game)
      Checks if the Pawn can perform an en passant capture on a given square.
      Parameters:
      startSquare - The square where the Pawn is located.
      game - The current game object, which contains the state of the game.
      Returns:
      true if en passant is possible, false otherwise.

    • promote

      public void promote(Square start, Square end, Game game)
      Promotes the Pawn to another piece (Queen, Rook, Knight, or Bishop) when it reaches the opponent's back rank.
      Parameters:
      start - The square where the Pawn is currently located.
      end - The square the Pawn is moving to.
      game - The current game object, which contains the state of the game.

    • getPromotedPieceNotation

      public static char getPromotedPieceNotation(Piece promotedPiece)
      Returns the notation character for the promoted piece.
      Parameters:
      promotedPiece - The piece the Pawn has been promoted to.
      Returns:
      The notation character of the promoted piece (e.g., 'Q' for Queen).

    • allowedCapture

      public boolean allowedCapture(Square start, Square end, Game game)
      Determines if the pawn is allowed to capture a piece on the end square. A capture is valid if the pawn moves diagonally to capture an opposing piece, or if en passant is possible.
      Specified by:
      allowedCapture in class Piece
      Parameters:
      start - the starting square
      end - the ending square
      game - the current game instance
      Returns:
      true if the capture is allowed, false otherwise
